poem:
**Uncertain Lines**

In echoing halls, shadows entwine,  
chasing whispers of what might have been.  
A student sleeps beneath London's night,  
while questions hold their breath.  
  
In the corridors of what-ifs and if-onlys,  
grief, a silent consultant,  
tiptoes beside empty beds,  
tallying time's relentless march—  
pages turned, but unread.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
